title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message:
History:- I got this unit with key board not working and same time extremely slow... External keyboard was working, System was slow even after disconnecting J4500. It was taking too much time to boot.

1) I have tried to clean ME using medusa... That didn't solve the problem 
2) I had some images got from forum, Not sure working or not..First image successfully programmed.
3) After that  the flash stopped detecting ,  Medusa giving error CHIP NOT DETECTED 

No idea whats went wrong, At the moment macbook is not booting anymore

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message:
What is the exact code of your board?
Is basic information to put in title.

Try with new BIOS chip.

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message: Board is 820-00239, Should I try feeding 3.3V_SUS externally?

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message:
Aaaa, you are trying through J6100.
In such case, 3V from Medusa can be used and USB-C charger is not needed.
The voltage is available on pin 2 of the 6 pins (not mounted) connector, near the Port A.
Solder a convenient wire, to provide 3V3_SUS for MLB.

However, 3V3_SUS is not controlled by U6100.
Reprogramming SPI chip (even externally), will not bring back 3V3_SUS.
You should check the power on sequence.

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message: Just measured the  3V3_SUS after connecting the charger its 3.3V, Still medusa says no chip detected

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message: Tie SMC_ONOFF_L to board for 5s and test again.

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message: One of the pin in the Medusa port A connector was bad. Fixed it and programmed the flash. Now I could see just a question mark on the screen.... Not booting ☹️

With the new image, it's not finding boot media.

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message:
ALS = Ambient Light Sensor.

Did PRAM reset?
Fsys checksum fixed after reflashing BIOS?
Did you clean ME for sure?

Save important data and reinstall macOS.

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message: Is it normal that the fans are not running while booting?

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message:
To check ALS, tap the webcam, or direct flashlight on it.
Backlight screen and keyboard should react then.

You can test it in Traget Disk mode with older MacBook, using proper USB cable adapter.
Or use newer, T2 machine, with Thunderbolt cable.

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message:
Fans probably spin only when CPU gets hot.
I don't have the same board here to test.

If machine still works slow with USB macOS and J9600 disconnected, then is not a problem related with internal SSD.
Also shouldn't be BIOS issue, if ME region was properly cleaned.

Check the CPU usage.

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message: Removed the board and checked PP3V0_G3H_AVREF_SMC it is 0.143V

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message:
We are now close to solve it.
Check diode mode to ground first.
If good, change U5165.

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message: Excellent, issue fixed ... It was not U5165 ,but one of the 10uF decoupling capacitor what was bad. You guys are simply awesome...

title: 820-00239 a1706 -2016 A1706 (EMC 3071) NOT DETECTING FLASH
message: Thank you so much
